data.title: President of Cape Verde
data.meta_description: The president of the Republic of Cape Verde, is an island country in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of West Africa, and has been the title since the establishment of the office of president in 1975. data.text:
The president of the Republic of Cape Verde, is an island country in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of West Africa, and has been the title since the establishment of the office of president in 1975. Aristides Pereira was the first person to hold the office, taking effect on 8 July 1975. The incumbent is José Maria Neves, having taken office on 9 November 2021.

Term limits[]

As of 2021, there is a two-term limit for the president in the Constitution of Cape Verde. The first president for whom the term limits applied was Monteiro in 2001.
